heading: seagate blitzes forecasts
subheading: a year after laying off 10,000 people, the disk-drive giant comes in with a us$104 million quarterly profit, beating the street ... big time.
author: reuters
text: disk-drive giant seagate technology on tuesday reported sharply improved earnings that beat even the most optimistic expectations, helped by cost-cutting and a rebound in the computer storage industry. net income jumped to us$104 million, or 42 cents a share, for the company's second quarter ended 1 january this year, compared with a loss of $183 million, or 75 cents a share, the prior year. seagate (seg) boosted its revenue in the quarter to $1.8 billion from $1.67 billion.the earnings per share in the most recent period easily surpassed the consensus estimate carried by the research service first call, which forecast a 26-cent per share net income. "the numbers were fantastic," said dan niles, analyst with bancboston robertson stephens.and in meetings with analysts later, the company said the improvement would carry on into the new year. "they indicated that demand for their products remained strong through the end of the year, and that's a little bit atypical -- normally it should drop off," said mark specker of soundview financial group.the strong report marked an upbeat beginning for new chief executive stephen luczo, who took over last july when co-founder alan shugart was forced out as seagate's president and chief executive in the midst of a serious downturn for the company.luczo's cost-cutting efforts, which he began as company president, led to a solid gain in seagate's profit margin. the improvements in getting products to market helped boost sales, the company said. seagate also benefited from a general uptrend in the disk-drive industry this year, paced by steady growth in the pc market as well as in network servers, analysts said.copyright
